rows.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
I swear by those who draw themselves out in ranks
Then those who drive away with reproof,
Then those who recite, being mindful,
Most surely your Allah is One:

rows.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ
rows.translation: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, and Lord of the easts.
rows.transliteration: rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā warabbul mashāriq

rows.arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلْكَوَاكِبِ
rows.translation: Surely We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment, the stars,
And (there is) a safeguard against every rebellious Shaitan.

rows.arabic: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلْمَلَإِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ
rows.translation: They cannot listen to the exalted assembly and they are thrown at from every side,
rows.transliteration: lā yassamma`ūna ilal-mala-il-a`lā wayuqdhafūna min kulli jānib

rows.translation: Being driven off, and for them is a perpetual chastisement,

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ ٱلْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ
rows.translation: Except him who snatches off but once, then there follows him a brightly shining flame.
rows.transliteration: illā man khaṭifal khaṭfata fa-atba`ahu shihābun thāqib

rows.arabic: فَٱسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَآ ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍۭ
rows.translation: Then ask them whether they are stronger in creation or those (others) whom We have created. Surely We created them of firm clay.
rows.transliteration: fastaftihim ahum ashaddu khalqan am man khalaqnā ۚ innā khalaqnāhum min ṭīnin lāzib

rows.translation: Nay! you wonder while they mock,
And when they are reminded, they mind not,
And when they see a sign they incite one another to scoff,

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: And they say: This is nothing but clear magic:
rows.transliteration: waqālū in hādhā illā siḥrun mubīn

rows.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
rows.translation: What! when we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then certainly be raised,
rows.transliteration: a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamab`ūthūn

rows.translation: Or our fathers of yore?
Say: Aye! and you shall be abject.

rows.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
rows.translation: So it shall only be a single cry, when lo! they shall see.
rows.transliteration: fa-innamā hiya zajratun wāḥidatun fa-idhā hum yanẓurūn

rows.translation: And they shall say: O woe to us! this is the day of requital.

rows.arabic: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
rows.translation: This is the day of the judgment which you called a lie.
rows.transliteration: hādhā yawmul faṣlil ladhī kuntum bihi tukadhhibūn

rows.arabic: ٱحْشُرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ وَأَزْوَٰجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: Gather together those who were unjust and their associates, and what they used to worship
rows.transliteration: uḥ-shurul ladhīna ẓalamū wa-azwājahum wa mā kānū ya`budūn

rows.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
rows.translation: Besides Allah, then lead them to the way to hell.
rows.transliteration: min dūnillāhi fahdūhum ilā ṣirāṭil jaḥīm

rows.translation: And stop them, for they shall be questioned:
What is the matter with you that you do not help each other?
Nay! on that day they shall be submissive.
And some of them shall advance towards others, questioning each other.

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
rows.translation: They shall say: Surely you used to come to us from the right side.
They shall say: Nay, you (yourselves) were not believers;

rows.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍۭ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَـٰغِينَ
rows.translation: And we had no authority over you, but you were an inordinate people;
rows.transliteration: wa mā kāna lanā `alaykum min sulṭān ۖ bal kuntum qawman ṭāghīn

rows.arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَآ ۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
rows.translation: So the sentence of our Lord has come to pass against us: (now) we shall surely taste;
So we led you astray, for we ourselves were erring.
So they shall on that day be sharers in the chastisement one with another.
Surely thus do We deal with the guilty.

rows.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوٓا۟ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
rows.translation: Surely they used to behave proudly when it was said to them: There is no god but Allah;
rows.transliteration: innahum kānū idhā qīla lahum lā ilāha illallāhu yastakbirūn

rows.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍۭ
rows.translation: And to say: What! shall we indeed give up our gods for the sake of a mad poet?
rows.transliteration: wayaqūlūna a-innā latārikū ālihatinā lishā`irin majnūn

rows.translation: Nay: he has come with the truth and verified the apostles.
rows.transliteration: bal jā-a bil ḥaqqi waṣaddaqal mursalīn

rows.translation: Most surely you will taste the painful punishment.

rows.arabic: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: And you shall not be rewarded except (for) what you did.
rows.transliteration: wa mā tujzawna illā mā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.translation: Save the servants of Allah, the purified ones.
For them is a known sustenance,
Fruits, and they shall be highly honored,
In gardens of pleasure,
On thrones, facing each other.
A bowl shall be made to go round them from water running out of springs,
White, delicious to those who drink.

rows.arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
rows.translation: There shall be no trouble in it, nor shall they be exhausted therewith.
rows.transliteration: lā fīhā ghawlun walā hum `anhā yunzafūn

rows.translation: And with them shall be those who restrain the eyes, having beautiful eyes;
As if they were eggs carefully protected.
Then shall some of them advance to others, questioning each other.

rows.arabic: قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّى كَانَ لِى قَرِينٌ
rows.translation: A speaker from among them shall say: Surely I had a comrade of mine,
rows.transliteration: qāla qā-ilun minhum innī kāna lī qarīn

rows.translation: Who said: What! are you indeed of those who accept (the truth)?

rows.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
rows.translation: What! when we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be certainly brought to judgment?
rows.transliteration: a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamadīnūn

rows.translation: He shall say: Will you look on?
Then he looked down and saw him in the midst of hell.
He shall say: By Allah! you had almost caused me to perish;

rows.arabic: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّى لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
rows.translation: And had it not been for the favor of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought up.
rows.transliteration: walawlā ni`matu rabbī lakuntu minal muḥḍarīn

rows.translation: Is it then that we are not going to die,

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
rows.translation: Except our previous death? And we shall not be chastised?
rows.transliteration: illā mawtatanal-ūlā wa mā naḥnu bimu`adhhabīn

rows.translation: Most surely this is the mighty achievement.
For the like of this then let the workers work.

rows.arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
rows.translation: Is this better as an entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum?
rows.transliteration: adhālika khayrun nuzulan am shajaratuz zaqqūm

rows.translation: Surely We have made it to be a trial to the unjust.

rows.arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِىٓ أَصْلِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
rows.translation: Surely it is a tree that-grows in the bottom of the hell;
rows.transliteration: innahā shajaratun takhruju fī aṣlil jaḥīm

rows.translation: Its produce is as it were the heads of the serpents.

rows.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَـَٔاكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
rows.translation: Then most surely they shall eat of it and fill (their) bellies with it.
rows.transliteration: fa-innahum la-ākilūna minhā famāli-ūna minhal buṭūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
rows.translation: Then most surely they shall have after it to drink of a mixture prepared in boiling water.
rows.transliteration: thumma inna lahum `alayhā lashawban min ḥamīm

rows.translation: Then most surely their return shall be to hell.
Surely they found their fathers going astray,
So in their footsteps they are being hastened on.
And certainly most of the ancients went astray before them,
And certainly We sent among them warners.
Then see how was the end of those warned,
Except the servants of Allah, the purified ones.
And Nuh did certainly call upon Us, and most excellent answerer of prayer are We.
And We delivered him and his followers from the mighty distress.
And We made his offspring the survivors.
And We perpetuated to him (praise) among the later generations.
Peace and salutation to Nuh among the nations.
Thus do We surely reward the doers of good.
Surely he was of Our believing servants.
Then We drowned the others
And most surely Ibrahim followed his way.
When he came to his Lord with a free heart,

rows.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
rows.translation: When he said to his father and his people: What is it that you worship?
rows.transliteration: idh qāla li-abīhi waqawmihi mādhā ta`budūn

rows.translation: A lie-- gods besides Allah-- do you desire?
What is then your idea about the Lord of the worlds?
Then he looked at the stars, looking up once,
Then he said: Surely I am sick (of your worshipping these).
So they went away from him, turning back.

rows.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
rows.translation: Then he turned aside to their gods secretly and said: What! do you not eat?
rows.transliteration: farāgha ilā ālihatihim faqāla alā ta-kulūn

rows.translation: What is the matter with you that you do not speak?
Then he turned against them secretly, smiting them with the right hand.
So they (people) advanced towards him, hastening.
Said he: What! do you worship what you hew out?
And Allah has created you and what you make.

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ لَهُۥ بُنْيَـٰنًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِى ٱلْجَحِيمِ
rows.translation: They said: Build for him a furnace, then cast him into the burning fire.
rows.transliteration: qālub-nū lahu bunyānan fa-alqūhu fil jaḥīm

rows.translation: And they desired a war against him, but We brought them low.

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّى ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
rows.translation: And he said: Surely I fly to my lord; He will guide me.
rows.transliteration: waqāla innī dhāhibun ilā rabbī sayahdīn

rows.translation: My Lord! grant me of the doers of good deeds.
So We gave him the good news of a boy, possessing forbearance.

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعْىَ قَالَ يَـٰبُنَىَّ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ فِى ٱلْمَنَامِ أَنِّىٓ أَذْبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: And when he attained to working with him, he said: O my son! surely I have seen in a dream that I should sacrifice you; consider then what you see. He said: O my father! do what you are commanded; if Allah please, you will find me of the patient ones.
rows.transliteration: falammā balagha ma`ahus sa`ya qāla yābunayya innī arā fil manāmi annī adhbaḥuka fanẓur mādhā tarā ۚ qāla yā-abatif-`al mā tu-mar ۖ satajidunī in shā-allāhu minaṣ ṣābirīn

rows.translation: So when they both submitted and he threw him down upon his forehead,
And We called out to him saying: O Ibrahim!

rows.arabic: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ ٱلرُّءْيَآ ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: You have indeed shown the truth of the vision; surely thus do We reward the doers of good:
rows.transliteration: qad ṣaddaqtar ru-yā ۚ innā kadhālika najzil muḥsinīn

rows.translation: Most surely this is a manifest trial.
And We ransomed him with a Feat sacrifice.
And We perpetuated (praise) to him among the later generations.
Peace be on Ibrahim.
Thus do We reward the doers of good.
Surely he was one of Our believing servants.
And We gave him the good news of Ishaq, a prophet among the good ones.

rows.arabic: وَبَـٰرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ مُبِينٌ
rows.translation: And We showered Our blessings on him and on Ishaq; and of their offspring are the doers of good, and (also) those who are clearly unjust to their own souls.
rows.transliteration: wabāraknā `alayhi wa`alā is-ḥāq ۚ wa min dhurriyyatihimā muḥsinun waẓālimul linafsihi mubīn

rows.translation: And certainly We conferred a favor on Musa and Haroun.
And We delivered them both and their people from the mighty distress.
And We helped them, so they were the vanquishers.
And We gave them both the Book that made (things) clear.
And We guided them both on the right way.
And We perpetuated (praise) to them among the later generations.
Peace be on Musa and Haroun.
Even thus do We reward the doers of good.
Surely they were both of Our believing servants.
And Ilyas was most surely of the apostles.
When he said to his people: Do you not guard (against evil)?
What! do you call upon Ba'l and forsake the best of the creators,
Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of yore?
But they called him a liar, therefore they shall most surely be brought up.
But not the servants of Allah, the purified ones.
And We perpetuated to him (praise) among the later generations.
Peace be on Ilyas.
Even thus do We reward the doers of good.
Surely he was one of Our believing servants.
And Lut was most surely of the apostles.
When We delivered him and his followers, all--
Except an old woman (who was) amongst those who tarried.
Then We destroyed the others.
And most surely you pass by them in the morning,
And at night; do you not then understand?
And Yunus was most surely of the apostles.
When he ran away to a ship completely laden,
So he shared (with them), but was of those who are cast off.
So the fish swallowed him while he did that for which he blamed himself
But had it not been that he was of those who glorify (Us),

rows.arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِى بَطْنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
rows.translation: He would certainly have tarried in its belly to the day when they are raised.
rows.transliteration: lalabitha fī baṭnihi ilā yawmi yub`athūn

rows.translation: Then We cast him on to the vacant surface of the earth while he was sick.
And We caused to grow up for him a gourdplant.

rows.arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِا۟ئَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
rows.translation: And We sent him to a hundred thousand, rather they exceeded.
rows.transliteration: wa-arsalnāhu ilā mī-ati alfin aw yazīdūn

rows.translation: And they believed, so We gave them provision till a time.
Then ask them whether your Lord has daughters and they have sons.

rows.arabic: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَـٰثًا وَهُمْ شَـٰهِدُونَ
rows.translation: Or did We create the angels females while they were witnesses?
rows.transliteration: am khalaqnal malā-ikata ināthan wahum shāhidūn

rows.translation: Now surely it is of their own lie that they say:
Allah has begotten; and most surely they are liars.
Has He chosen daughters in preference to sons?
What is the matter with you, how is it that you judge?
Will you not then mind?
Or have you a clear authority?
Then bring your book, if you are truthful.

rows.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُۥ وَبَيْنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ ٱلْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
rows.translation: And they assert a relationship between Him and the jinn; and certainly the jinn do know that they shall surely be brought up;
rows.transliteration: waja`alū baynahu wabaynal jinnati nasabā ۚ walaqad `alimatil jinnatu innahum lamuḥḍarūn

rows.translation: Glory be to Allah (for freedom) from what they describe;
But not so the servants of Allah, the purified ones.
So surely you and what you worship,
Not against Him can you cause (any) to fall into trial,
Save him who will go to hell.

rows.arabic: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
rows.translation: And there is none of us but has an assigned place,
rows.transliteration: wa mā minnā illā lahu maqāmun ma`lūm

rows.translation: And most surely we are they who draw themselves out in ranks,
And we are most surely they who declare the glory (of Allah).
And surely they used to say:

rows.arabic: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
rows.translation: Had we a reminder from those of yore,
We would certainly have been the servants of Allah-- the purified ones.
But (now) they disbelieve in it, so they will come to know.
And certainly Our word has already gone forth in respect of Our servants, the apostles:
Most surely they shall be the assisted ones
And most surely Our host alone shall be the victorious ones.
Therefore turn away from them till a time,
And (then) see them, so they too shall see.
What! would they then hasten on Our chastisement?

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
rows.translation: But when it shall descend in their court, evil shall then be the morning of the warned ones.
rows.transliteration: fa-idhā nazala bisāḥatihim fasā-a ṣabāḥul mundharīn

rows.translation: And turn away from them till a time
And (then) see, for they too shall see.

rows.arabic: سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
rows.translation: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Honor, above what they describe.
And peace be on the apostles.
And all praise is due to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
